Now supports arbitrarily typed messages based on Tertiary Text by VGMoose https://github.com/vgmoose/tertiary_text

[New Functionality]

Make sure you are running the latest watchapp and companion app at the same time.

data.description:
Texter allows you to create a tree of messages which is then sent to your Pebble and allows you to shoot off quick replies right from your watch.

Now also supports typing messages on your Pebble from scratch. Input based on Tertiary Text by VGMoose

Navigation
----------------

The app uses a navigation system whereby the action in bold is performed on a single click and the action not in bold is performed on a long press of the key. The back button returns you to the previous list.

How to Use
----------------

When the app is launched you are given the option to message either the last person who you had a conversation with or the first person in your favourite list. A long press on either takes you to a list of 6.

You can then navigate the tree of messages which you can customise on the companion app. Anything prefixed with a + means it is a sub menu. Anything else is a message that when you click will send the relevant message to the person you selected.

Text Input
-----------------
While in text input mode the inputs are changes to:

* Single button press take you through the letter tree
* Hold up to switch to caps and symbols
* Hold down to go back to previous tree level
* Hold select to send the message

---

This app is open source: https://github.com/tocsick/texter
Tertiary Text: https://github.com/vgmoose/tertiary_text

data.description: he unlock code is 13321 where the right buttons are 1,2,3 from up to down. With TimeTracker (TT) you are able to clock your daily work time including your flex time account and time rules. TT provides an easy to use interface with the possibility to set 16 clocks per day. At the end of each day you can do an "end of day" to save the clocks into a weekly overview and to save the new flex time value. Work times will be saved for the current week and will be reseted at the first "end of day" in the new week. Features: - "en" language - Clock up to 16 times per day - Display current work time / day end time / flex time - Display break time - Indicates a connected / disconnected BT connection - Hide mode for more privacy - TimeTable for the last week / current flex time / lost time - Display "last time charged" in the time table - Inverts and vibrates when loosing time because of the time rules For detailed information review the documentation at: http://www.albmail.de/Pebble/TimeTracker/TimeTracker.pdf (Thanks Jo) If you like the watch face please donate: pebble.donate@albmail.de

data.description:
Vitals is a Timer/Watchface Pebble App assisting Nurses in measuring the heart rate of their patients.

When you start to measure the patient's heart rate, press the middle button to start the timer.  There will be a brief delay allowing you to get ready.  The watch will vibrate at the start of the timer, signaling you to begin counting the patient's pulse.  Once the timer has finished, the watch will vibrate again, signaling the end of the timer.  During this time, only the seconds hand will appear on the watch face showing the timer's current value.  The watch's backlight will also remain on for the full duration of the timer.

When in the non-timer mode, this app will show an analog watchface, displaying the day-of-week and day.  The date will change locations on the display making it unobstructed by the watch hands.

There are 3 settings you can change: Heart Beat Count Time, Start Delay, and Vibration.  To change the settings perform a "long press" of the Middle Button to bring up the settings screen.

Special Thanks to Janette L, RN for her testing and encouragement.

Version 1.3
* added 'Seconds Hand' setting to reduce battery usage

Version 1.2
* added support for Pebble Time

Version 1.1
* added '15 seconds' option to the HB Count Time setting

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble Time Round

data.description:
The perfectly Pebble-sized strategy game has arrived. Reversi, marketed in the US as Othello and in Hong Kong as Apple Chess, is the classic game of surrounding tiles, flipping fortunes, and outwitting your opponent. Place a token that puts the other side's tiles between your own, and they belong to you. But watch that they don't get taken back again. 
* Grocery-line sized play: a game lasts only minutes, and autosaves on exit in case you want to come back later. 
* It thinks! Play against a devious tiny AI at four levels of difficulty. 
* Switch to 2-player and surreptitiously pass along your Pebble to another challenger wherever you are. 
* Press Back once for options, twice to quit.

 Bugs, comments, feature requests can go to @theoreticalb. Also accepting plaudits. 

(Note: I open sourced this with the MIT license. So if you'd like to use the code to make Pebble Checkers or Attaxx or whatever, go for it! I'd love to play). Banner image includes photography by Paul_012 and is licensed CC BY-SA 3.0.

data.description:
Simple imperial to metric conversion app that allows you to quickly convert between units by drilling down in menus until you find a value of sufficient accuracy.

So the less precision you require, the fewer number of button presses you need!

Currently supported conversions:

Miles <-> Kilometres
Pounds <-> Kilograms
Fahrenheit <-> Celsius
Calories <-> Kilojoules
Feet <-> (International) Nautical Miles*

* Hidden by default. Enable in Settings.

Basic settings dialog allows you to customise which conversions are shown, so you can hide the ones you don't use.

More units will be added as I find a need for them or they are requested.

Note that this is written in Pebble.js, so unfortunately it is slower than it could be, and requires a connection to the phone. I do have plans to do a new version at some point in C so it runs completely on the watch, but it is proving to be more difficult than I anticipated. Help would be very welcome.

changelog.release_notes: Kleine nieuwe feature: klik tijdens het bekijken van doorkomsten op Select om de lijst te vernieuwen. Enjoy!

De app werkt weer na een breaking change aan de API van De Lijn. Bedankt aan iedereen die dit probleem heeft getweet naar @DriesOeyen. In een volgende update schakelen we over naar een betrouwbaardere manier om te communiceren met De Lijn, waardoor dit niet meer zou mogen gebeuren. Deze update zal eveneens ondersteuning bieden voor de nieuwe features van de Pebble Time. Tot binnenkort dus!
Busuren ophalen werkt weer zoals het hoort. De oorzaak van dit probleem was een wijziging aan de API van De Lijn.
Verbeterde betrouwbaarheid bij het toevoegen en verwijderen van haltes.
Verbeterde betrouwbaarheid van de app en het configuratiescherm.
Busuren laden nu veel sneller en je hebt de mogelijkheid om alle lijnen bij een bepaalde halte te bekijken. Dit kan je instellen via de Pebble app.

data.description:
Check snel real-time doorkomsten van bus of tram aan je favoriete haltes van De Lijn – onmiddellijk op je Pebble.

Deze app is onafhankelijk ontwikkeld en wordt niet beheerd of ondersteund door Vlaamse Vervoersmaatschappij De Lijn. Ontwikkeld voor pendelaars in Vlaanderen, België.

latest_release.release_notes: Kleine nieuwe feature: klik tijdens het bekijken van doorkomsten op Select om de lijst te vernieuwen. Enjoy!

data.description:
Do you like tapping black tiles? Why not play it on your wrist?!

Click Tiles is a simple reflex game. Click as many black tiles as you can while racing against the clock. Watch out for the white ones though, clicking one of them ends the game!

Click Tiles includes 3 playing modes: 
   > Endless - How many tiles?
   > Sprint - How fast to click 30 tiles?
   > Lap - How many tiles in 30 seconds?

data.author: SeaPea Software

changelog.release_notes:
Added App Glance support for OS 4.
Also added a vibe when the alarm is automatically reset with 'Get Out Of Bed' alarm turned on.
Fixed a few bugs with the 'Get Out Of Bed' alarm when set to turn on after the primary alarm is stopped.

Fairly extensive rework of the code to make sure it fits in the original Pebbles including the latest features.

- New Feature: Get Out Of Bed Alarm - Turn this on in the Smart Alarm Settings section to get a secondary alarm X minutes after your normal alarm that can automatically turn off if you stand up and take 5 paces with no more than 2 seconds between each step. It also has a distinct alarm pattern.
- Get Out Of Bed Alarm has 2 modes that you toggle through in the settings: 
1) X Minutes after alarm start for those of us who are habitual snoozers
2) X Minutes after stopping alarm for those that manage to turn off the alarm in their sleep even with Konami Code enabled

New Feature: Auto-Close - Automatically closes Gentle Wake after X minutes of inactivity (no button presses, no active alarm or snoozing, etc) which goes back to your default watch face.

Fixed alarms and graphical glitches on original Pebbles using the new v3 firmware (with Timeline). There is one case of crashing if you go into the Snooze Delay or Monitor Period and then go to set some alarms. For now, just exit the app between changing the settings and alarms.
Tweaked design for Pebble Time Round
Added support for Pebble Time Round

Fixed corner cases with alarm skipping.
Fixed alarm not stopping when an alarm is configured for only a single day.
Improved the randomness of the 'Konami' code method of stopping the alarm (yes I realize that a random code is not really *the* Konami code...)

Added patch to prevent repetitive random konami codes. 
Fixed alarm skipping (hold Up on main screen) in certain cases. 
Fixed alarm info when using 12 hour clock. 
Added version number to the bottom of the settings menu
Fixed a bug in the alarm settings screen and also fixed a major crash on the original Pebbles as all the new features caused them to run out of memory.

Multiple new features in this release:
- Added one-time alarm that replaces any regular alarm in the next 24 hours (and then goes back to the normal set alarms)
- Multiple vibration patterns: Gentle (original), Not-So-Gentle (starts with longer vibrations), and Not-So-Gentle after 2 snoozes (original for the first 2 times)
- Added better alarm skip UI (hold the Up button on the main screen to automatically skip and then restart alarms for up to 4 weeks)
- When within 10 hours of the next alarm, the main screen shows the hours and minutes remaining before the alarm

Added random Konami Code setting for stopping alarm to really make sure it is not stopped accidentally. (Go to the in-app settings and toggle the 'Stop Alarm' setting. Then when stopping the alarm a random quondam code will be shown which must be entered using the watch buttons)
Updated to work with OS 3.0 on Pebble Times and added a splash of color

Added Daylight Savings Time (DST) Check. The Pebble OS APIs currently do not handle DST changes, so due to the various DST rules around the world, which change regularly, the app now wakes once a week to check for DST changes and adjust alarms if necessary. By default this is at 4am on Sundays, but this can be changed in the settings in the app if your country changes over on a different day. If Gentle Wake was not open before the DST Check then it immediately closes so it should not interfere with anything running.

Also improved skipping alarms (hold Up on main screen with no active alarm) so up to 6 days can be skipped by repeatedly holding and releasing the Up button. Holding Up after 6 days skipped, cycles back to no skips and disabling & re-enabling alarms or changing settings also resets the skipping.
Fixed 12PM appearing as 12AM, oops...
Improved error message when wakeup API fails
Improved feedback when skipping next alarm
Hold up button on main screen to toggle skipping next alarm (so you don't have to remember to re-enable alarms for one exception)
Improved robustness in setting wakeup
Added sensitivity setting for the Smart Alarm
Added clearer instructions for stopping alarm and made recovery from forced exit better

data.description:
- Alarms for each day of the week
- Smart Alarm attempts to wake you if it detects you stirring shortly before the alarm time, which is the Monitor Period (doesn't interfere with background activity apps)
- All settings are in-app (Down button on main screen) 
- Alarm vibration starts gentle and gets longer and longer to gradually wake you and this can be adjusted with the Vibration Pattern setting
- Alarm will vibrate for just over a minute and will then auto-snooze to save battery
- Doesn't need to be manually started for the alarms to work (set and forget)
- While Alarm is vibrating, a single click on any button snoozes the alarm. 2 quick clicks are required by to turn off the alarm to reduce the chance of accidentally turning it off
- Change the 'Stop Alarm' setting to 'Konami Code' to show a random sequence of buttons to turn off the alarm to help really make sure you are awake
- Dynamic snooze halves the initial snooze time on each snooze until it reaches 3 minutes - for those of us with a habit of hitting snooze repeatedly ;)
- Can temporarily disable all alarms (Single Up button click on main screen)
- 'Easy Light' - hold your Pebble vertically to turn on the backlight while the alarm is vibrating/snoozing (no need to shake your wrist!). Can be turned off.
- Skip alarms by holding Up on the main screen and choose a date to skip until (alarms restart on that date.) Disabling & enabling alarms, or going into the settings resets skips
- DST Check sets the day of the week on which it checks if your location has switched to/from Daylight Savings Time

latest_release.release_notes:
Added App Glance support for OS 4.
Also added a vibe when the alarm is automatically reset with 'Get Out Of Bed' alarm turned on.

data.title: Gentle Wake (Daily Smart Alarm Clock with Sleep Monitoring)

data.description:
View the stars, constellations, and planets of the night sky.

The up and down buttons change the field of view.  Click the middle button for custom settings, selecting planets, or choosing a constellation.

The orientation can be set by compass, tilting the Pebble, or can be locked to a specific heading.

Memory is tight, so only 1,000 stars are in black and white and 4,000 stars for the Pebble Time.

Voice dictation is supported for Pebble Time watches. To use this feature, select "Voice" from the menu, and clearly state the name of a planet or constellation. Some sample terms to try are "Moon" and "Aquarius".

latest_release.release_notes: 2.2  Voice Dictation added

data.description:
This watchapp is designed to use as little power as possible overnight. It achieves this by not doing anything until you press the Select button which lets the processor stay in a low power mode.
It also features a daymode if you happen to run low on battery during the day. You can enable this mode by holding Select for about 5 seconds.
Power saving tips: https://www.notehub.org/08ooy
